Class DistributionUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • DistributionUtility

  • public class DistributionUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class is a Utility Class that is a collection of Distributions in the Project.
    Author:
    Damini Singh, Rudresh Ajgaonkar

    • Method Detail

      • getObjectLifetime

        public int getObjectLifetime()
        Considering *Poission distribution* while calculating the lifetime of various Objects. Poisson Distribution provides values independent of Each Other. Average value considered is 100
        Returns:
        Object Life Time [Poission Distribution]

      • getAvgNumberOfObjectsPerSegment

        public int getAvgNumberOfObjectsPerSegment()
        Using Normal Distribution We get the Average Number Of Objects Per Segment. We Use Mean = 2 and Standard deviation = 1
        Returns:
        average_in_int

      • getObjectDirection

        public int getObjectDirection()
        Specifies the Direction of the Object Movement. For example if an object enters the screen from left, it can either go E, NE or SE. Similarly there will be other directions for Object Initiating movement from right,bottom,top.
        Returns:
        direction

      • getStartEdge

        public int getStartEdge()
        Object Starts from Edge Left - 0, Bottom -1 , Right - 2, Top - 3.
        Returns:
        startEdge.

      • getVerticalStartPoint

        public int getVerticalStartPoint()
        Gets the Vertical Point on the Screen. The Range Assumed here is 0 to 640.
        Returns:
        point between 0 to 640.

      • getHorizontalStartPoint

        public int getHorizontalStartPoint()
        Considering the Horizontal Range as 0 to 960. Gets the Horizontal start point for the Object.
        Returns:
        Horizontal Pixel Coordinate.

      • getObjectSize

        public int getObjectSize()
        Size of the Objects can range from 1x, 2x .. 5x x - Pixel
        Returns:
        size

      • getObjectSpeed

        public int getObjectSpeed()
        Here we are Considering Variable Speed for Various Object. We Are Using Uniform Distribution for the Speed of the Object.
        Returns:
        Speed of the Object.
